com.pega.pegarules.pub.context

Interface PageDirectory

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    PRNode, PRRequestor, PRThread

    public interface PageDirectory
    The PageDirectory interface provides methods to associate ClipboardPage instances with a name and to sever that association. To maintain consistency with internal data members of ClipboardPage instances, page names should be modified only via methods in the page instance.

    Implemented by PRThread and PRReqeustor.

    • Method Detail

      • findName

        java.lang.String findName(ClipboardPage aPage)
        Returns the name of the specified page. aPage ClipboardPage whose name is to be retrieved String specifying page name, or an empty string if no name assigned
        Parameters:
        aPage -
        Returns:
        name

      • getPage

        ClipboardPage getPage(java.lang.String aName)
        Returns the page with the specified name. If no such page exists, creates a new empty page. The attempt to look up the page is made in circular manner at various scopes. For e.g. If the api is called from Thread scope page would looked up at following scopes thread -->(threadfamily)-->requestor-->node If the api is called from Requestor scope page would looked up at following scopes (threadfamily)-->requestor-->node-->thread. Thread family scope would only be looked up if threadfamily is enabled.
        Parameters:
        aName - String name of page, if null or blank, a new page is always created.
        Returns:
        ClipboardPage instance

      • getPage

        ClipboardPage getPage(java.lang.String aName,
                      ParameterPage aParameterPage)
        Returns the page with the specified name and parameters. If no such page exists, creates a new empty page. The attempt to look up the page is made in circular manner at various scopes. For e.g. If the api is called from Thread scope page would looked up at following scopes thread -->(threadfamily)-->requestor-->node If the api is called from Requestor scope page would looked up at following scopes (threadfamily)-->requestor-->node-->thread. Thread family scope would only be looked up if threadfamily is enabled.
        Parameters:
        aName - String name of page, if null or blank, a new page is always created.
        aParameterPage - parameters to be passed to page, can be null
        Returns:
        ClipboardPage instance

      • getPage

        ClipboardPage getPage(java.lang.String aName,
                      ParameterPage aParameterPage,
                      boolean aCreateIfMissing)

      • getScope

        int getScope()
        Returns the scope of the implementor of PageDirectory
        Returns:
        One of SCOPE_NODE, SCOPE_REQUESTOR, SCOPE_THREAD

      • removePage

        boolean removePage(java.lang.String aName)
        Removes the association between the specified name and the ClipboardPage.
        Parameters:
        aName - String name of page to remove
        Returns:
        true if successful

      • removePage

        boolean removePage(java.lang.String aName,
                   ParameterPage aParameterPage)
        Removes the association between the specified name and the ClipboardPage.
        Parameters:
        aName - String name of page to remove
        aParameterPage - Parameter when the page being removed is a data page.
        Returns:
        true if successful

      • removePage

        boolean removePage(ClipboardPage aPage)
        Removes the association between the specified ClipboardPage and any name it has been given.
        Parameters:
        aPage - ClipboardPage to remove
        Returns:
        true if successful

      • renamePage

        boolean renamePage(ClipboardPage aPage,
                   java.lang.String aName)
        Renames the page to the specified new name. If the name is in use by another page, that page becomes unnamed.
        Parameters:
        aPage - ClipboardPage to be renamed
        aName - String with new name
        Returns:
        true if successful

      • getDeclarativePageNames

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getDeclarativePageNames()
        Returns all Data pages in the directory. This will include both Readonly as well as Editable data pages.
        Returns:
        A set of datapage names. Will be empty set if there are no data pages in the directory

      • removeDeclarativePage

        boolean removeDeclarativePage(java.lang.String aPageToBeFlushed)
        Removes the given data page instance from memory. You can pass a decorated name or definition name. If the definition name is passed then parameters are assumed to be present in the execution stack. If there are no parameters in the stack, then it will assume null parameters.
        The page is also removed from async cache.
        For Node level pages, a pulse entry is recorded.
        Parameters:
        aPageToBeFlushed - A decorated page name or just definition name.
        Returns:
        true if data page instance is found and removed.

      • shouldCreateReduxPage

        default boolean shouldCreateReduxPage()
        Based on flag set in setCreateReduxPageFlag(boolean) returns appropriate value
        Returns:
        boolean. 'true' to indicate create redux clipboard page. 'false' to indicate create legacy clipboard page.

      • setCreateReduxPageFlag

        default void setCreateReduxPageFlag(boolean createReduxPageFlag)
        set 'true' to enable creating redux page. It also sets a internal threadlocal variable to true set 'false' to disable creating redux page. It also sets a internal threadlocal variable to false This method could be called from one requestor with 'true' which sets internal threadlocal variable to true. then a new requestor could be spawned in the same thread and could miss passing this flag, in which case we still read from threadlocal
        Parameters:
        createReduxPageFlag - to be passed.
